channel.title: C# vs. C++
channel.description:
Hi there. So I have two options for classes this summer...one that deals with C#, and one that deals with C++, and I'm wondering which one to take. Which would you guys suggest? I'm not looking for easier...I'm looking for more useful when pursuing a job in the computer programming industry. I'm good with PHP and Java now, if that changes anything.
Thanks.

item.title: C# vs. C++
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:
@zstars wrote:

[quote=“Wewt, post:1, topic:338254”]Hi there.
So I have two options for classes this summer…one that deals with C#, and one that deals with C++, and I’m wondering which one to take.
Which would you guys suggest? I’m not looking for easier…I’m looking for more useful when pursuing a job in the computer programming industry.
I’m good with PHP and Java now, if that changes anything.

Thanks.[/quote]

I suggest that you try both and pick the one you prefer, both languages are nice and their features are not subsets of each other’s, but learning any of them will help with the other. Learn about their applications too, as in, when it’d be more appropiate to use each one.

Read full topic

item.title: C# vs. C++
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

When I saw that you had replied to this thread, Lothy, I was waiting for a PM mentioning that my warning level had been raised. Glad we see eye to eye on this subject, LoL.

Just learn all that is languages, find which one best fits your situation, implement it, ???, profit. Sometimes it is a matter of opinion rather than actuality.

Read full topic

item.title: C# vs. C++
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

C# is honestly very similar coding-wise to Java, so if you already know Java it might be somewhat of a waste of time to take a C# class. C++ offers an invaluable chance to learn about writing native code, and I think it may be more valuable to learn than C# or Java because both languages are actually implemented using C++. Also if you want to write games, C++ is still the most used for that as well.

Both are valuable, I’d go with C++ though, if it was me.

Read full topic

item.title: C# vs. C++
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

I think C# is a lot easier to learn by yourself than C++, however it is likely a C++ class won’t cover nearly as much in terms of OOP and respective APIs because of this.

Read full topic

item.title: C# vs. C++
item.dc:creator: @Wewt Wewt
item.description:
@Wewt wrote:

Mopman:

EDIT: By prior experience, I did notice that you mentioned PHP and Java, but I meant proper experience. I hope you don’t take offence to that, because I haven’t seen any of your code, but in these parts people who say they use PHP and Java generally don’t know shit.

Thanks for the feedback. My previous experience is all self-taught, meaning my coding style is probably crap by professional standards. I think I will go with the .Net class.

Thanks a lot.

Read full topic

item.title: C# vs. C++
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Game Design != Programming, FWIW

This is a kinda hard question to answer, because to be sure, C++ will be the language you end up using if you go into game development. If by “desktop applications” you mean in-house work then it will more than likely be .Net. Since you’re keeping your options open, you’ll probably want to learn both eventually.

If there’s no other differences between the classes and you have no prior experience of programming, I’d probably suggest taking the .Net class to get the basics and then teaching yourself C++ later once you have the foundation, mainly because the vast majority of C++ teachers are awful.

Others probably disagree with me.

EDIT: By prior experience, I did notice that you mentioned PHP and Java, but I meant proper experience. I hope you don’t take offence to that, because I haven’t seen any of your code, but in these parts people who say they use PHP and Java generally don’t know shit.

Read full topic

item.title: C# vs. C++
item.dc:creator: @Wewt Wewt
item.description:
@Wewt wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:3, topic:338254”][quote author=Wewt link=topic=434646.msg3191662#msg3191662 date=1272318085]
I’m looking for more useful when pursuing a job in the computer programming industry.
[/quote]

What kind of job? There are more C# jobs, but are they the jobs you’d be going for?[/quote]

I’m looking either into going into game design or desktop applications. I want to get a degree in computer science though so I can stay open to other jobs in the industry.

Read full topic
